DOC.brief_summary: There is an urgent need to control our current national outbreak of carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae (CRKP). The purpose of this study is to eradicate CRKP gastrointestinal carriage using selective digestive decontamination (SDD); with buccal and oral gentamicin and polymyxin E administration. This will reduce infections and hopefully mortality caused by CRKP.
DOC.brief_title: Selective Digestive Decontamination in Carriers of Carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella Pneumoniae
DOC.criteria: Hospitalized men and women with a positive rectal swab for CRKP Age 18 years or older Age less than 18 years Pregnant women, lactating women A known allergy to the study drugs
